Event Organiser Sign Up

Making events safer

Receiving updates from all checkpoints simultaneously in real-time means you know which teams were last seen when and where, or more importantly which teams haven't been seen for some time!

Monitor on the move

Designed for use on any mobile device, using Checkpoint Live means you can be on the move and still monitor the event.

Need to be flexible during the event? Add new checkpoints for transports or ad-hoc locations and everyone connected to the event will be updated.

Improving communication

Gone are the days of mishearing via radio or misinterpreting handwriting. Inputs are made by individuals at the checkpoint and distributed to everyone in a readable format, in real-time.

With a chat-room included for every event you can contact all of your checkpoint marshals and they can contact you, clearly and transparently; no contact information required.

What is Checkpoint Live?

Checkpoint Live was developed initially for the Scout and Guide communities to enable real time updates on where the teams of young people are as they participate in orienteering activities such as an incident hike. Now it can be used by any event with manned checkpoints/bases.

Checkpoint Live can be used via the website to record when, where and who visited a specific checkpoint/base. With the added ability to record any scores taken at that location.

This replaces the need for radio updates or sending messengers to collect records of team sightings from across the countryside.

Importantly for the organisers it removes the data entry into the HQ system as all logs are entered by the checkpoints. This data can even be copied as a table into Microsoft Excel™

What if I have bad mobile reception?

Being out in the countyside means there is no guarantee of mobile reception. While this situation is improving, Checkpoint Live utilises the very latest technologies to enable you to use the site despite intermittent data reception.

All devices maintain a local store of the logs their checkpoint records. If a device ever goes offline you can continue to add to this store before later re-connecting and syncing back up with Checkpoint Live and the other users of the event. The size of the data stored and sent is so small that only the slowest internet speeds are required even fleetingly.

Further to this, if you are a Chrome or Firefox user Checkpoint Live will even load when you are offline meaning you only require the internet for signing in and sending or recieving logs and messages and don't get bogged down downloading a website too.

All this adds up to Checkpoint Live feeling more like an app than a website but without having to get everyone to download and install anything!

UPDATE: Apple Safari users fortunate enough to be using the very latest IOS 11.3 or MAC 10.13.4 software can also take advantage of using the website offline thanks to new updates that were released on the 29th of March 2018. Safari does impose some restrictions; the websites will automatically delete themselves from the offline cache if they are not used for a few weeks, so please bare this in mind.

New features

Branding

You can now add your own logos to your event page to give it that personal feel.

Location tracking

Now you can record location in addition to your standard logs.

Improved admin HQ

Along with all of the raw logs coming in from checkpoints, checkpoint live will update a last seen (least recent at the top) and leaderboard tabs for admin users.

How the participants in the event will be referred to (default: Team).
Number of teams*
The number of teams you will track with checkpoint live.
Password protect checkpoint selection

This will require those using checkpoint live to enter a unique passcode to gain access to their checkpoint, this limits user's access only to checkpointss they have the passcode for. If this option is turned off all users with the event log-in will be able to select the checkpoint they are logging visits for from a drop down list. (The Admin area always requires a passcode).

Log off route entries

This will allow your event users to log when they see a team, even if they are not due to participate at that checkpoint yet. This is useful from a safety perspective as every team sighting is recorded.

Automate time entry

Turning this on will remove the need for users to enter time information into the website when recording a log entry. Instead the time in and out of the checkpoint is set as to the time that the submit log button is pressed. This is useful for quicker submission of logs.

Live feed to a tracking server

Turning this on will enable a live feed of locations to be sent to a tracking server whenever a log is recorded; this remains at the user's discretion to enable location services on their device and only applies to checkpoints which have 'record location with log' turned on below.

Enter the url of your tracking server below to receive tracking updates via the OsmAnd protocol:
